arts.ttl: Burnley player ratings vs Cardiff City as 6/10s and 7/10s handed out across the board - gallery
arts.sum: Burnley were forced to hold on to a crucial three points last night as they dug deep to beat Cardiff City.

arts.ttl: Football League: Burnley concede at last but win anyway; Birmingham lose
arts.sum: Clarets beat Cardiff despite clean sheet run ending at 12 Bolton stun League One leaders; Wycombe close gap Burnley’s run of Championship clean sheets finally came to an end on Tuesday night, but they kept the heat on in the promotion race with a 2-1 win at Cardiff. Yousef Salech’s firm header in the 42nd minute was the first goal the Clarets had conceded in 1,132 minutes of league action, a run of 12 consecutive clean sheets broken. But by the time Salech scored it, early goals from Josh Brownhill and Maxime Estève had already put Scott Parker’s side in charge, and the win puts them two points behind second-placed Sheffield United. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: JJ Watt can stay in retirement after James Trafford’s clean sheet streak ends
arts.sum: Watt had told Trafford he would consider returning to the NFL if the Burnley goalkeeper did not concede again this season.

arts.ttl: 'You need to dig in': Scott Parker's immediate reaction to Burnley's win against Cardiff City
arts.sum: Scott Parker says it’s all about the three points as Burnley were forced to hold on for a nervy victory against battling Cardiff City.

Callum O’Dowda played a chipped ball over the head of Maxime Estéve, to which Salech got on the end of to divert it towards goal, but saw it tap against the post of James Trafford . The visitors took the lead on the 19-minute mark as Josh Brownhill tapped in from close range after being found by Hannibal Mejbri’s pass on the edge of the six-yard box.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City player ratings v Burnley as star man a real handful but others struggle on frustrating night
arts.sum: This is how the Bluebirds players rated against the Clarets in this midweek Championship encounter

arts.ttl: Burnley win to close on top two but finally see clean sheet run end
arts.sum: Burnley conceded a Championship goal for the first time in 13 games but kept the heat on Leeds and Sheffield United by winning 2-1 at Cardiff.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City 1-2 Burnley: Clarets keep up pressure on Leeds United and Sheffield United with nervy win
arts.sum: Burnley cut the gap to the Championship’s top two back to two points with a nervy win against lowly Cardiff City.

arts.ttl: Cardiff City 1-2 Burnley: Bluebirds pay price for early errors and miss huge chances as they fall to defeat
arts.sum: The Bluebirds welcomed the Clarets to Cardiff City Stadium this evening

arts.ttl: Burnley run of Championship clean sheets ends but Clarets still see off Cardiff
arts.sum: The visitors’ defence was finally breached after 1,132 minutes of Championship action.
